data.author: sfcgeorge

changelog.release_notes: Remove bars from top and bottom. Colors still customizable though.
Added complications! Check out settings. Each corner now has a complication with 2 customizable slots. There are many options to choose from: time, date, weather, battery and more.
Initial release with basic analogue face.

data.description:
Complications-Analogue. A highly customizable watchface yet with minimal design and fast code.

Each corner has a "complication" with 2 customizable slots‚Äîyou can show 8 pieces of data! There are many options to choose from: time, date, weather, battery and more, check out settings.

The colors can be changed and the background inverted for your own personal look!

* Line on the minute hand shows battery level.
* When plugged in the second hand blob moves to the other end, and when charging it disappears.
* Second hand can be disabled to reduce battery usage.
* If the battery gets to 20% the second hand disappears to reduce battery usage.
* If bluetooth connection drops the middle dot turns white.

latest_release.release_notes: Remove bars from top and bottom. Colors still customizable though.

data.author: Nev Rawlins

changelog.release_notes: Added support for Pebble 2 and Quick Views
Version 2 adds support of black and white Pebbles

data.description:
Digital watchface inspired by light shimmering on the edges of some pine forest trees.

Easy to read, with hours at top and minutes at bottom.  

12 or 24 hour format depending on watch setting.  12 hour format has A or P bottom right to indicate AM or PM respectively.

The image changes at sunrise and sunset.  


Screenshots:  
  (1)   9:23AM 
  (2)  10:58PM
  (3) 15:47 (24-hour format) 
  (4) 23.56 (24-hour format)
  (5)   6:33 (with Quick View)


This design is just for the Pebble, but I also have a number of designs from the Tokyoflash Design Studio ported on the Pebble, so check these out too - click on "More from this Developer"

Notes.  
On start-up, it takes a little while to get the sunrise/sunset information.  During this time, the daytime view is always shown.   Please be patient if it's night-time.

If you change location and the sunrise/sunset times change significantly, you would have to either wait until the next day for them to be picked up correctly or press the middle button and back with the left button

When Quick Views occur, the AM/PM indicator is masked out until the Quick View is over.


Finally, some thanks:
- to Sam Jerichow for help with original and Quick View background images 
- to Vladimir Agafonkin whose SunCalc JavaScript library enables calculation of  sun position, sunlight phases, moon position and lunar phase for the given location and time
- to Andy Barry who used SunCalc in his version of Simplday watchface - I borrowed some of his code in my Javascript


Design & Programming Copyright ¬© 2015 Nev Rawlins

latest_release.release_notes: Added support for Pebble 2 and Quick Views

data.title: Forest

data.author: Sam Jerichow
data.description:
Summary: lines that reveal themselves as numbers
Readability: medium
Examples: 08:36, 12:59, 14:25, 20:47

The watchface Sanctus is made of lines that look cryptic at first but reveal themselves to be lit parts of normal numbers. There are the expected four numbers but they are black on black background. To make them visible, each of them has two sides lit up by an imaginative lightsource in the very center of the watchface. Normally one expects all four numbers to be lit the same way - and that would make them easier to read - but placing the light source in the middle, creates a nice little artwork that at certain times resembles a cross. That's why I gave it the name Sanctus. 

Design / Programming / Copyright ¬© 2015 Sam Jerichow
data.title: Sanctus

data.author: Rainbows Puppies & Sunshine
data.description:
Analog face with hour numbers randomly assigned a position along the chapter ring.  

At 3:00, the hour hand will point to the 3 (wherever on the clock face that may be) and the minute hand will point 
to the 12 (wherever that may be).   On a regular clock face, the hands would always form a right triangle at 3:00, but on the RandAlog Face, there's no telling what angle will form because the 3 and the 12 will be randomly positioned.

The odds of this face ever appearing like a regular clock face is 1 in 47,9001,600; or about once every 911 years.
data.title: RandAlog

data.description:
Summary: sketchy numbers
Readability: easy

 I was sketching for some nice numbers and thought, I could use this little imperfection for a watchface. The four numbers of Sketch never look the same, just as if you redraw the same thing again and again but never exactly like before. I tried a look between pencil and coal and kept it black on white. Possible future customization not excluded... Hope you enjoy!

Design / Programming / Copyright ¬© 2015 Sam Jerichow

data.description:
Watchface inspired from the polar clock, now for the Pebble Time in a nice colorful design.
The inner circle represents the hours and slowly fills at AM and pour out at PM.
The middle circle represents the minutes and fills every minute at even hours and pour out at odd. The outer circle shows the battery state, unter 10% the arc shows red. A red Bluetooth symbol shows the loss of connection.
12h/24h format supported.

Settings:
-language (german/english)
-color of hour, minutes and date

Update: charging indicator shown when plugged-in
improvement of battery and memory usage

data.author: Starthief
data.description:
Analog+digital watchface in the style of a hit 1981 video game.

The position of the player's ship indicates the hour.  The enemy's position indicates 5 minute intervals, and the length of the spike indicates the remainder of the minutes.

The score (top left) is the time, and the high score is the battery charge (80% in the screenshot) and current date (Tuesday the 18th).

changelog.release_notes: Fixed issue in case quick view is already visible on startup of Essential.

Added support for Pebble 2
Added step counting for Pebble Time, Pebble Time Steel and Pebble 2
Added Heart rate monitoring for Pebble 2
-Brought back the slick animations to the OG Pebble
-Removed animations and snow for Aplite (was causing too many problems)

-New Winter/Christmas color presets
-New Realistic Snow Fall (Static, shake for snow, or snow globe effect)
-New Battery Icon
-New Animations
-New Pebble Time Round Shake Features

New features

Bugs
- Pebble Time Round Crash Fix
- Animation Fixes
- Other Bug Fixes

- Pebble Time Round Support
- Date icon adjustment
- Weather fix for 3.6 release
Now use Yahoo weather as standard weather provider instead of OpenWeatherMap
Fixed location weather support. Now you can turn of your smartphone GPS to save on battery!
Fixed issue that prevented some users from changing the settings when in trial mode

data.description:
Kiezel Watchfaces | Essential

This is a paid watch-face. You can purchase this face individually for $0.99 or purchase our entire collection of 20+ faces for $5.99. You can purchase within the settings page.

Essential brings the style of the Pebble smartwatch to your watchface. It is fully customizable. You can customize the colors of the icon fills, icon stroke, time text, text box, text box stroke, and the color. You can also toggle icons to display date, weather, battery or steps. Choose what temperature unit you want to see. Also it supports both 12hr time and 24hr time. Choose how often to update the weather to save on battery. Also included is vibrate on bluetooth disconnect and show b/w version on bluetooth disconnect.

NOTE: Those that don't have a license will be using a 24hr trial. After 24hrs, the face will go back to default black/white state.

Enjoy!

Kiezel-
data.title: Essential

data.author: Kurt Lawrence

changelog.release_notes:
v2.3 - Build 7 - 2016.02.21
- Added a battery uptime clock, tracks the hours since last charge
- Remove bluetooth icon when phone is connected, now only shows on disconnect
- Vast code improvement to save battery and memory
- Fixed a bluetooth status problem where the icon would not be correct when the face opened

- Added a bluetooth connection information icon.
- Added an indicator beside the compass for true or magnetic compass bearing. Pebble will show magnetic north until declination is found.
- Fixed a memory leak bug that would crash the application after numerous GPS updates.

- Heavily reprogrammed backend to increase battery life and stability
- Fixed a bug where GPS update could result in 0.00 latitude
- Fixed a unnoticed bug where East and West headings were reversed (sorry, never tested it!)
- Updated the square root math function for increased accuracy
- Add shake functionality to force update GPS and toggle compass
- Compass update frequency reduced to 2 degrees, larger drain on battery so it is recommended to keep off
- Small asthetic changes in display
- Add version update screen to alert users of new versions and instructions
- Added a (forgotten!) AM/PM denominator for time
- Now pings phone for GPS only every 12 hours at 5am/pm to conserve battery. Force updating can be used in lieu.

Fixed a few minor running problems and a major displaying bug on Pebble time watches.
-Fixed a disappearing moon phase icon by creating a global display bitmap - used this method with all text and bitmap layers
-Changed the update cycle to only update on minute = 0 (was updating every minute within the specified hour)
-Pebble Time watches were making the text transparent, fixed this by making text set to White rather than Clear...
-Proper display messages for no GPS data and no rise times.
Fixed a forced GPS update for when app is loaded

data.description:
Displays interesting location based data like compass heading and bearing, sun rise and set times, moon rise and phase, battery status, and GPS coordinates, along with time and date data.
Does not require internet connection!
Please show your appreciation through liking this watch face.

How it works;
The watch face will obtain GPS location data from your phone daily, at the same time calculating 7 days worth of moon rise time data. Sun rise and set, and moon phase data is calculated on the watch itself. Accuracy is generally within 10 minutes. Compass bearings are calculated as magnetic north until a declination is found, for which Pebble is developing.
Please be patient with gesture recognition, and try to limit compass usage as it drains battery. The gestures are triggered with repetitious shaking or tapping, for example the options screen is displayed after three shakes within one minute.

latest_release.release_notes:
v2.3 - Build 7 - 2016.02.21
- Added a battery uptime clock, tracks the hours since last charge
- Remove bluetooth icon when phone is connected, now only shows on disconnect
- Vast code improvement to save battery and memory

data.title: Astronomy Face

data.author: Nev Rawlins

changelog.release_notes: Added configuration option to display in 24-hour mode.  Needs the watch to be set in Time Format 24h as well.
Fixed problem when Quick View present on watchface load (restricted used space)
Added support for Pebble 2 and Quick Views.  Requires Pebble firmware 4.0.1 or later.
Requires Pebble firmware 3.14 or later.   Corrects hour "digits" (2, 4, 6, 9).  New settings features: hide PM and on white bezel PTR, change background to black.
Added PM indicator and set midnight hour to 12 rather than 0.

Fixed defect when configuration screen accessed, nothing changed and submitted.  If presets previously selected, the value was incorrectly changed to color selection.
Fixed 2 defects for Pebble Time Round watches with white bezels:
- For RAF Rondel preset, on returning to the watchface from notifications or after selecting one of the right buttons, the white color was lost.
- If chosen white for minute color, which is also used for 10-hour, this is set to black, but lost on returning to the watchface from notifications or after selecting one of the right buttons.
Fixed defect on Pebble Time Round watches with white bezels - now if white color is selected on the config screen, this inverts to black.
Persists chosen colors on Pebble Time Round with white bezel (previously always reverted to black shapes)
Fixed JS problem stopping access to configuration page
Adding support for Pebble Time Round

data.description:
A futuristic hybrid watchface - part-analog, part-digital.

The 5-minutes appear in typical analog positions.  The additional 4 single minutes just inside that on the right.  The one of a 10-hour, appears on the left, just inside the 5-minute ring and the single hours are built from segments of rings forming sci-fi glyphs that are recognisable as digits, as with the 'Quadrant' watchface.  A central circle appears as the PM indicator.

Configuration options:
- colors for the hour digits, minute segments and the 5-minute ring
- 2 pre-sets that use 3 colors for the rings, which makes it more cryptic
- whether or not the PM indicator is displayed
- display in 24-hour mode (Pebble must be Time Format 24h)

   
Screenshots show:  
(1) 12:48PM - blue 5-min, cyan min, red hour
(2) 09:57AM - blue 5-min, cyan min, red hour
(3) 12:19AM - RAF Rondel (blue-white-red) 
(4) 12:34AM - Bull's Eye (cyan-red-yellow)
(5) 06:51AM - cyan 5-min, green min, red hour (Quick View)


This watchface design was created by Peter Fletcher, from the UK, and is published with the designer's permission.   

Note. 24-hour mode requested by Leon Kaleja who also suggested the format - thanks Leon.

latest_release.release_notes: Added configuration option to display in 24-hour mode.  Needs the watch to be set in Time Format 24h as well.

data.title: Quadrant Hybrid

changelog.release_notes:
This version adds an outline around the time (Pebble Time only) to make it easier to read, date display, battery status, and Bluetooth disconnect support.

If anyone really wants the old version without the new features please let me know!

data.description:
Paragade/Renegon, Paragon or Renegade?

Basic digital watch face for the Pebble smartwatch. Features:
  * Updates once per minute
  * Includes battery status
  * Supports Aplite (original Pebble) and Basalt (Pebble Time)
  * Displays when Bluetooth connection is lost and optionally vibrates
  * Configurable color for time and date - Basalt (Pebble Time) ONLY


Acknowledgements

  * Font ISL Jupiter by Isurus Labs (http://www.dafont.com/isl-jupiter.font)
  * Font outline handled via https://github.com/ygalanter/EffectLayer
  * Paragon and Renegade Logo Vector by Karlika (http://karlika.deviantart.com/art/Mass-Effect-Vector-Pack-178422616)
  * Menu Icon by http://jcros.deviantart.com/art/Renegade-or-Paragon-210356653

If anyone really wants the old version without the new features please let me know!

latest_release.release_notes:
This version adds an outline around the time (Pebble Time only) to make it easier to read, date display, battery status, and Bluetooth disconnect support.

If anyone really wants the old version without the new features please let me know!

data.description:
Wear a QR code in public that when scanned, allows the person to send messages to your Pebble Time.

When someone scans your QR code, a browser will open on their phone and they can type messages to appear on your watch anonymously.

Messages also show up on your Timeline.

Useful as a way for strangers to engage with you and to meet new people.

This also works even if it is not your default watch face. It just needs to be loaded on your watch for you to receive messages.

UPDATES:
Due to Pebble gradually phasing out the timeline this app will no longer be updated.

latest_release.release_notes: Force animation by losing and regaining bluetooth connection.

data.description: A big digital watchface where each digit is constructed from a 3x3 block grid.  Most numbers are immediately easy to read and the rest are easy to decipher -- in this screenshot the time is 08:35 on Saturday the 15th.
data.title: Nines

data.author: Starthief
data.description:
An analog watchface hidden in plain sight.  The three vertices of the black triangle are the center of the watch, the hour hand, and minute hand -- in the first screenshot the time is 8:27.

Even when the hour and minute hand align, the other triangles point to them to reveal the time -- the second screenshot is 9:15 and the third is 6:30.
data.title: Polybius

data.description:
A simple but unique watchface that shows the minute 'hand' as an orbiting circle containing the numeric time.

The face is configurable: change the accent colour to match your outfit. You can also show/hide the date.

data.title: Orbit

data.author: Jake Lockhart

changelog.release_notes: 1) Now available in color for Pebble Time! Woohoo! 2) Restructered the backgrounds to more intuitively communicate the current battery level. 3) Fixed the 3 in "13" and "23." It was backwards. Not sure how I managed that.

data.description:
And now supports color on the Pebble Time!

A honeycomb watchface where the density of the "honey" cells represents the remaining battery power. Now with 75%* more intuitive battery representation! Supports 12hr and 24hr time.

*This number may be completely made up.

latest_release.release_notes: 1) Now available in color for Pebble Time! Woohoo! 2) Restructered the backgrounds to more intuitively communicate the current battery level. 3) Fixed the 3 in "13" and "23." It was backwards. Not sure how I managed that.

This is my first watchface for PebbleTime. It is inspired by the Utility watchface of the Apple Watch.

Shows:
- digital time
- analog time
- weekday and date
- battery percentage
- Bluetooth disconnect

Options:
- enable/disable second hand
- enable/disable bluetooth status
- select between 5 different watchfaces

No further updates or support... I've sold my Pebble! Sorry.
